page.title: 04RECREATION-HAMSTERLEY FOREST
page.content: Hamsterley Forest covers over 5000 acres and provides varied environments The Commission has encouraged use of the land for recreation,employing a Forest Ranger responsible for planning The area is crossed by many public paths,used regularly by walkers and horse riders,there are also marked walks,varying from 1 to 8 miles,which are away from the main forest roads. Other activities include the use of forest roads for car rallies,pony trekking,orienteering events,picnic sites with toilet facilities,fun runs, as well as the opportunity for specialised studies of the wide variety of flora and fauna.An Information Centre and shop have been created so that large numbers can be catered for during the busy summer months.There is a small fee for cars entering the forest.
